Description: Two small wool textile fragments (fabric types B and F) two of which are sewn to one another [Main and 2nd fabric] and used as a wrapping. No evidence of association could be observed between the connected Main/2nd fabric and the 3rd fabric. The spinning direction of warp and weft of all fragments is 's'. The first piece is an irregular shape, a natural colour, with plain weft-faced weave. Some of the warp is overspun. The thread count is warp 6 per 10mm and weft 32 per 10mm. The second piece is dark brown with two red woven bands [warp direction, 1cm wide] as decoration, attached to he first piece by stitching [ss/zply] with dark brown thread. The thread count is warp 6 per 10mm and weft 24 per 7mm. The third piece is a dark blue band, with a neatly folded edge stitched with bright blue thread [ss/zply], a hem. It has a second band of the same fabric attached to the other edge and sewn: the sewing thread consists of 2 elements 's'-spun and 'z'-plied, light brown in colour. The textile thread count is warp 7 per 10mm and weft 14 per 10mm. Some of the warp threads are overspun.
Dimensions: Length: 130 millimetres (warp, Main/2nd fabric - after conservation)
Width: 165 millimetres (weft, Main/2nd fabric - after conservation)
Bibliographic references: Adams et al 1999 / Kulubnarti III: The Cemeteries (p. 62)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 93.2.117A (excavation object cat. no.)
Excavation/small finds number: 93.2.117B (excavation object cat. no.)
